comments:
The current version of the Btm-Muse tools is still VERY unforgiving! 

E.g. I "dared" to rename an operation while creating a capability and now the server startup always fails on me yelling that the generated(!) .wsdl file still refers to that old operation name but that it can not find the corresponding method.

I have completely removed all generated code, I have searched the entire root project (i.e. the one that contains the .mcap and the .mrt files from which I then generate the Axis2/J2EE server code and the Client-Proxy code) for that old operation name. I searched the .mcap, .mrt, .dd, .rmd and the .xsd file for that string, even the .project file. I found nothing!

I also restarted eclipse and I several times restarted tomcat (after clearing its working directory and removing and re-adding the project) to make sure nothing is cached. 

How come that the generated .wsdl file still refers to the old operation name???

I don't get it! Where do these BtM/Muse tools keep such info???

Michael

This is the exact stacktrace (the "addPolicy"-operation was renamed to "acceptPolicy" and thus doesn't exist any more):

java.lang.RuntimeException: [ID = 'MissingOperationImplementations'] The WSDL file '/wsdl/impactPolicies.wsdl' has the following operations which have no match in any of the resource's capabilities: [http://www.ibm.com/impactPolicyHandling/AddPolicyRequest]

Can you confirm that you ran code gen again after making the change? Also you may try with the eclipse -clean option.

Oops - forgive me to not having closed this. Turned out, that my compare tool had a wrong option (case sensitive search) enabled by default and so it didn't find the string while it actually was still there.
(I had just re-installed my machine back then and so some tools still needed their preferences "massaged" which I hadn't realized, since I was used to my normal pref's settings).
If I recall correct, then just some visible name had been changed by the rename operation, but internally the old element- or method-name (or similar) was indeed still using the original name.

Sorry,
Michael

1.I created Operation1 in capability file i,e new_file.mcap
2.Added new_file.mcap file to mrt file i,e new_file.mrt and generated code and deployed in Tomcat 
3.and able to Access deployed TP through MAX, and verified Operation1 is vissible
4.now i updated Operation1 name to Operation11 and saved  new_file.mcap
5.Again Generated Code from MRT and deployed it in Tomcat
6.Connect the TP through MAX, noticed that Updated Custom Operation name doesnt reflect in operations list, instead old Custom Operation name shows up.

Build: TPTP-4.4.0-200703270100

Muse 2.2 generates the operation name based on the name of XSD element name, but in tooling we change the operation name only, because changing the XSD element name could lead to the improper wsdl file. There is already a bug open in Muse for it

http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MUSE-214

Since the remaining problem is a Muse problem it cannot be fixed in time for 4.4. Reducing priority (since it does not affect function) and moving to future. To the original reporter-> I will post your question on the tptp newsgroup and we will follow up there.
